meanings.definition: The community of organisms that live on or in the bottom of a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The benthoses in the lake include small fish and algae.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the benthoses to understand the ecosystem of the ocean floor.
meanings.sent3: The benthoses had a party at the seabed, and even the crabs joined in!
meanings.sent4: The benthoses form a bustling city on the ocean floor, each organism playing a unique role.
meanings.sent5: Diving down, you can see the benthoses creating a colorful mosaic below the waves.

meanings.definition: The benthic organisms collectively in a particular region.
meanings.sent1: The benthoses of this bay are diverse, with clams, worms, and starfish.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the benthoses to assess the health of the coastal ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The benthoses decided to have a race to see who could reach the seafloor first!
meanings.sent4: In the underwater forest, the benthoses sway gently with the currents like dancers.
meanings.sent5: The benthoses of the reef create a vibrant tapestry of life beneath the surface.
